locutie.beschrijving: A narrative retelling of the Book of Ruth, focusing on the movement from Naomi's despair to the redemption found through Boaz, culminating in the lineage of David and Jesus.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. The preacher provides historical context (famine, status of widows, go'el customs) and literary sensitivity to the text's structure.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily explaining the narrative to illustrate a theological principle about God's hidden providence.
voorbeelden: The story of Ruth shows us in an incomparable way that the blessings of God come to us through simple human means.
Boaz is deeply impressed by Ruth’s bravery and devotion.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Comfort and encouragement; recognizing God's hand in ordinary human kindness.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low. The Spirit is not explicitly mentioned as the agent of the word's efficacy.

voorbeelden: Naomi is therefore left in the most vulnerable condition possible.
The Old Testament takes a lot of knocks these days.
The world is indeed full of famine.
I hope that, when you go home, you will want to read the whole 'short story'.
We should not overlook this latter factor.
It is just too precious to ignore.
The soul is stirred by this.
The story of Ruth shows us... that the blessings of God come to us.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Weak. The 'promises' are framed as general theological observations rather than direct divine pledges to the hearer.

declaratieven.autoriteit: Low. The preacher remains a narrator/teacher rather than a herald of a new reality.

indicatoren: Extensive narrative retelling (3rd person past tense).
Theological conclusions framed as 'The story shows us' rather than 'God says to you'.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a spectator of a beautiful story rather than a participant in a divine encounter.

missende_elementen: Present-tense address of the Gospel to the specific congregation.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Preacher's personal study and collective 'we' of the audience.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: General 'you' (e.g., 'when you go home', 'when you reach out').
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used for hypothetical moral examples, not for sacramental address.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Naomi, Ruth, Boaz, and God's general actions.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: High. It keeps the action in the 'then and there' of the text.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Story) -> Assertive (Moral Principle) -> Directive (Implicit: Be like Boaz/Ruth).
voorbeelden: The story of Ruth shows us... When you reach out your hand... it is the hand of God.
foutief_patroon.probleem: It lacks the middle step of a Declarative/Commissive where God acts upon the hearer.

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: The story shows us... When you reach out... it is the hand of God.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a high-quality literary and theological lecture. It 'talks about' God's kindness but does not 'deliver' it as a performative act.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The retelling of the threshing floor scene.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The entire conclusion is third-person description.
zwakke_punten.probleem: No encounter with the living Christ.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is a 'talk about' an event (the story of Ruth) rather than being an event itself.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher does not speak 'in the name of Christ' to the hearer; he speaks 'about Christ' to the hearer.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: No. God is the object of discussion, not the subject of the speech act.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Weak. The preacher acts as a guide/teacher, not a mandatory.
tekstueel_bewijs: The story of Ruth shows us...

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly assumes that hearing the story will naturally lead to better behavior.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: No. The sermon is treated as a medium of information.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by 'is', 'was', and 'shows'. It needs 'I promise you', 'Christ forgives you', and 'Receive'.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The story of Ruth shows us... that the blessings of God come to us through simple human means.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, through this Word, God reaches out His hand to you and promises: 'I have not abandoned you in your famine.'
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a general observation to a direct divine address.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The 'Redeemer' is discussed as a historical figure or a general concept.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Directly apply the title of 'Go'el' to the hearer's current situation.
voorbeeldzinnen: Because Christ is your next-of-kin, your debt is paid.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use the second person singular/plural to deliver the Gospel.
voorbeeldzinnen: You, who feel like Naomi today, hear this: God has not forsaken you.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The imperative ('When you reach out') is a moral imitation rather than a response to a gift.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Base the call to kindness on the fact that the hearer has already been 'redeemed' by the Boaz-of-souls.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is homiletically beautiful but performatively thin. By shifting from 'talking about' the story to 'proclaiming' the reality it points to, the sermon can move from a lecture to a sacramental event.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the 'appeal' or 'self-revelation' of the preacher; SAT reveals the lack of a 'Declarative' act that changes the hearer's status before God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetorically, this is excellent storytelling. SAT, however, diagnoses that the 'force' is merely informative, not transformative.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT exposes that even a Christocentric sermon can be 'constative' if it only describes Christ without delivering Him.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The story of Ruth, Naomi, and Boaz finds its fulfillment in the only begotten Son of God.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Constative Surplus' where the beauty of the narrative replaces the power of the proclamation.
